Title: Efficacy and safety of mRNA COVID-19 vaccines in immunocompromised patients: a systematic review and meta-analysis
Authors: Smith, John A.; Rodriguez, Maria A.; Patel, Ravi K.
Abstract: Background: Immunocompromised patients have reduced immune responses to vaccines and increased risk of severe COVID-19. We assessed the efficacy and safety of mRNA COVID-19 vaccines in this population.
Keywords: COVID-19; mRNA vaccines; immunocompromised; meta-analysis; vaccine efficacy

Title: Machine learning approaches for early detection of sepsis in the intensive care unit
Authors: Johnson, Sarah K.; Williams, Michael R.; Davis, Jennifer L.; Thompson, David E.
Abstract: Objective: To develop and validate machine learning models for early sepsis detection using electronic health record data from ICU patients.
Keywords: sepsis; machine learning; intensive care; early detection; electronic health records

Title: CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing for treating inherited retinal diseases: current progress and future directions
Authors: Kim, Sung H.; Anderson, Lisa M.; Garcia, Carlos E.
Abstract: Inherited retinal diseases are a leading cause of blindness worldwide. CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing offers promising therapeutic potential for treating these conditions.
Keywords: CRISPR-Cas9; gene editing; inherited retinal diseases; ophthalmology; gene therapy

Title: Artificial intelligence in medical imaging: improving diagnostic accuracy for diabetic retinopathy
Authors: Patel, Arun K.; Zhang, Li M.; Taylor, James R.
Journal: Proceedings of the International Conference on Medical Imaging and AI
Abstract: We present a deep learning model for automated detection of diabetic retinopathy from fundus photographs.
Keywords: artificial intelligence; medical imaging; diabetic retinopathy; deep learning; diagnostic accuracy

Title: Long COVID syndrome: pathophysiology, clinical manifestations, and therapeutic approaches
Authors: Thompson, Emma L.; Davis, Michael J.; Wilson, Sarah K.; Martinez, Carlos A.
Journal: The New England Journal of Medicine
Abstract: Long COVID affects millions of patients worldwide. This comprehensive review examines the current understanding of long COVID pathophysiology.
Keywords: long COVID; SARS-CoV-2; post-acute sequelae; pathophysiology; treatment
